title: Hello There!
text:
Blog CV Projects




I’m the Lead Data Scientist for Housing Equity at the Department of Housing & Urban Development (HUD) in Washington DC. I’m on a funded fellowship through the Federation for American Scientists to build data and technology capacity within government.
In my current role I help create data and tools to investigate housing discrimination, build dashboards for policy-makers, and advise on long term IT/Data infrastructure needs. I love all things open source, mapping, and GIS!
I got my Masters in Geographic Data Science from the London School of Economics in 2023, and a Bachelor’s in Urban Studies and Economics from the University of Pennsylvania in 2019. Previously I worked as a Data Scientist for the Urban Institute, a Data Science Trainer at the LSE Digital Skills Lab, and a Data Science Consultant for the JED Foundation.
I’m also a certified scuba diver 🤿, an enthusiastic (but unskilled) soccer player ⚽, and an avid biker 🚲.
